str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.
From philos and hippos; fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of semaino; an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally.
(primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
